name: Dim Sum Palace
address: 123 William St, New York, NY 10038, USA

Dim Sum Palace? More like Dim Sum Paradise.  You havenâ€™t lived until you go.

Perfect for dinner on a Friday night. I know it might sound crazy, but those pork buns might be the best Iâ€™ve had. With each and every bite my tastebuds burst like a distant star.

Our group had a fantastic meal here. The food came in so many varieties and we were thoroughly stuffed. Highly recommend you get the private room in the back for larger groups.  Iâ€™m still craving their dumplings ğŸ¥Ÿ!â€¦
Bad service for order and pick up the food at the counter lady for to go

èƒ½åœ¨ç´ç´„åƒåˆ°å¾ˆæ¸¯å¼çš„é¤é»
è¶…æ£’â˜ºï¸ğŸ‘
Amazing food and great service! Loved the bean curd skin roll!!

Openly promoting racism.
Just put a sign on the front door that what sort of community people you guys will serve rather than deciding serving people on basis of their skin tone.
Highly offended by the serverâ€™s attitude.
God bless you guys.

My son and I were blessed to find this place. I couldn't keep my eyes off the wonderful menu display they have outside. Once you enter, you are transformed into a whole new world. The art Deco is fabulous, the service is Great and the food ... OMG!!!
We ordered green tea with our appetizers(roast duck spring rolls) WoW those were delicious and meal after sesame chicken and chicken fried rice was Amazing. if you're ever in the neighborhood do not miss out on going to this place. It is FABULOUS! Don't Miss Out  :-D

Food is nice.
Thats the new york dim sum standards

Great VIP rooms with karaoke. $500 minimum.

Loved the Peking duck and really loved the black bean chicken. Clean restaurant with really good Chinese food.

Well done.

Dim Sum Palace is fantastic! The food is fresh, flavorful, and served hot straight from the carts â€” just how dim sum should be. The dumplings are soft and packed with flavor, and the BBQ pork buns are a must-try. The atmosphere is lively and welcoming, and the service is quick and friendly. Perfect place to enjoy classic dim sum with friends or family.

This restaurant taught me not to trust reviews blindly. They create visually striking food that tastes excellent. Their food is definitely prepared with good ingredients. Team members offered outstanding service. This place thought of everything.
The service was fast and the food was good. Restaurant is also well decorated and bathroom was very clean.
Great food and was very clean!

Bland? Not complaining about service or atmosphere, but the food is subpar. Dim sum house, but the dim sum dishes were not well made. Soup dumplings had thick skin and little flavor, sichuan mushroom dumplings were again not flavorful, beef shumai was not good at all. Only redeeming factor was the fried spare ribs, which Iâ€™ll admit were a 10/10 amazing. But one dish out of five is scary. Iâ€™ve lived in China and visited Hong Kong multiple timesâ€¦ idk how to describe this place. At least itâ€™s affordable and fast.
They handled it all efficiently. A typical experience.
Great place ..great service and amazing food.  Highly recommend it.  Looking forward to coming back.
When you want tasty dim sum, *relatively* good service, and donâ€™t care how youâ€™ll feel tomorrow or what you put into your body

Had a wonderful dim sum lunch at the Dim Sum Palace. The restaurant was exceptionally clean with very attentive servers. There was a wide variety of dim sum to choose from and they were all delicious. While the restaurant was busy, it was never loud. I appreciated the ability to have a relaxing lunch with my spouse. Highly recommend for a unique lunch or dinner experience.

Excellent le Dim Sum et le service.
Good Restaurant

ä¸ä¼šå†æ¥ã€‚é™¤äº†å‡¤çˆªè¿˜ä¸é”™ï¼Œèƒ½åƒå‡ºé™ˆçš®å‘³ï¼Œå…¶ä»–éƒ½å¾ˆéš¾åƒã€‚é¦–å…ˆï¼Œä¸Šæ±¤è±†è‹—çš„å£æ„Ÿå¾ˆè€ï¼Œä¸€èˆ¬éƒ½è¦æŠŠè±†è‹—æ¢—æ‰¯æ‰çš„ï¼Œä¸çŸ¥é“æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯å•†å®¶ä¸ºäº†ä¾¿å®œè¿›çš„è´§ï¼Œå£æ„ŸçœŸçš„å¾ˆæŸ´å¾ˆè€ã€‚è¿˜ç‚¹äº†æœ¬æ¥¼ç‚–æ±¤ï¼Œæ˜¯èŒ¶æ ‘è‡æ°´é¸­æ±¤ï¼Œç»™çš„éƒ½æ˜¯é¸­å˜´å’Œé¸­è„–å­ï¼Œä¸¤ç¢—éƒ½æ˜¯è¿™æ ·ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ç»™å…¨éƒ¨æ‰”æ‰äº†ã€‚è¿˜æœ‰çº¢çƒ§è±†è…ï¼Œå‹¾èŠ¡è°ƒå‘³ä¸å¤Ÿæµ“ï¼Œè±†è…æ²¡æŒ‚ä¸Šå‘³ã€‚

I usually go to the location up in Ktown, but my touristy plans for that day led me to the Financial District. This place doesn't disappoint! The tofu I got was extremely soft (I'm a fan of soft tofu) and I ordered it with mild spice (because my poor taste buds don't have that much spice tolerance), which was the perfect level for me! The fish was also fresh, and I asked for a lighter fare on my palate with less oil which they did do for me. Even though I'm not a huge fan of seafood, man, that fish was good. (It's also an inside joke that an Asian restaurant is authentic if it comes with its own aquarium that hosts all the seafood XD). The decoration and atmosphere was also really cozy, with nice lighting and beautiful art.
Loved the dim sum

First & foremost my girlfriend & I where going through their extensive menu for nearly 10 minutes & NO ONE brought water to us

Also NO ONE checked up on us to ask us how our meal was & NO ONE said goodbye or come again after I paid

Maybe it was because we were the only black people in there at that moment in time I could be wrong but I did tip over 10%

However I will say the wait staff did an excellent job of keeping the table clean every time we were done with a dish

On to the food though

Garlic crispy pork ribs was good

Shrimp egg rolls were crispy

Hong Kong style wonton soup was one of the best wonton Iâ€™ve had

Shrimp dumplings were delicious

Shanghai egg & scallion fried rice

Pork fried rice was delicious & fresh better than Bronx Chinese fried rice the peas were crisp

Rose tea was good itâ€™s been awhile since I drank a tea without honey or sugar

I will only say that the MONEY of people of color is just as good as the money of your regular customers or your people of culture
This place is amazing.  Excellent service!! The Dim Sum was great and the Scallion Fried Rice was excellent. The roasted pork was to die for. I recommend this place!!
Very disappointed. Ordered takeout. 2x roast duck over rice. Barely any meat. Mostly bones. Not crispy very fatty.
Great place for authentic Chinese food. Wontons come on really nice, thin wrapping. Convenient location.
Canâ€™t say enough about this place we had the sweet n sour chicken and let me tell you. It was as close to perfect as you can get. Staff was amazing great setting was beautiful
Canâ€™t miss. Just go, you wonâ€™t regret it

Walked in at10:08pm after spending valuable travel time. They said kotchrn is close and the waiter behind him laughed we are from Miami and only had one opportunity to visit this place and we spend money to get there and the waiters possibly for not wanting to work didnâ€™t let us sit down

I had the soy chicken over rice bowl and it was fine. The chicken was quite fatty, so I had to trim a good chunk. Presentation was good, but taste was fine. Chinatown definitely has better quality. But for the area, it's a good option for Chinese food. Clean restaurant and great service. Ambiance is a 10.

We're especially unhappy about this 1 dish. It's the Vancouver crab (bei fung tong big crab). They cooked it wrong! Deep fried with a thick coating??? And zero sauce with...??? Itâ€™s $70 for not cooking it right! I regretted not complaining and kept thinking about why I'm paying so much for a dish that's done wrong! Servers never checked back with us if everything was alright! Too much corn starch and salt on some veg dishes. Eat dim sum if there.

Response to your answer:
Iâ€™m well aware of how this dish look and taste. Your link is exactly how it should be, but thatâ€™s not what was served! I wish I took a picture. The crab served has a thick fried batter like fish and chips and served very dry with dry onions. Didnâ€™t taste anything like Bei Fung Tong crab! No resemblance to the picture in your link! We were very disappointed!
This is the best Dim Sum/Chinese food ever! Why go to Chinatown
Food flavors are basic. Small number of dim sum selections

The food here is absolutely delicious â€” every single dish was amazing! Prices are very reasonable, making it great value for money. The service was also outstanding; the staff were friendly, attentive, and made the whole experience even better. Highly recommended!

Went here for lunch the other day and I would say itâ€™s the best dim sum in the area. Itâ€™s a little on the pricy side but worth it. The service was great. Our server Tony(if I remember correctly) was amazing. He was very knowledgeable and explained the whole menu to us. Everything he recommended was fantastic. Our favorite dish was the crispy shredded beef. I would definitely come back and recommend to others.

Came in with a party of five and had to flag down a server just to get noticed. When he finally came over, he carried a visible chip on his shoulder. Iâ€™m not naiveâ€”I understand my own culture deeply as a Cantonese person, and I know the difference between a bad day and blatant disregard.

The service was horrendous: muttering curses in Cantonese while serving, barely speaking to us, no greeting, no warmth. Yet, the Caucasian guests next to us were welcomed with smiles and attentive service. The contrast was undeniable.

Nevertheless, I will not spend my money where it isnâ€™t wanted. So we walked out.
Nice restaurant

Beautiful and bright dining area.
Great service.
Everything we tried was great, super fresh and delicious
They have lots of dumpling options and the ones I got were very tasty. The decor is also very cool, Iâ€™ll definitely go again :)
Always love coming here. Great comfort food with a lot of variety. Love the noodles, dim sum, and egg tart. Great price too. Highly recommend!
Duck was stiff and tasted not like the duck I used to have in other chinese restaurants.
Love it here so amazing
Among the best shumai/dumplings I've had in a long while. Excellent, flavorful hot n sour soup, and the spicy mushroom dumplings and chicken shumai were especially good.

my friend recommended me this place and it ended up being very good.
i had never tried a dim sum place before and i really liked that there was a menu you could check off but also a main menu.
the food was absolutely delicious, my sister and i both got the orange chicken and it was nice and crispy with enough sauce, as well as a side of white rice which was fresh.
we also got chicken dumplings and the taro dumplings from the dim sum menu.
i will definitely be back
Excelent place , great food .

ê¹”ë”í•˜ê³  ë§Œë‘ë„ ë°”ë¡œ ìª„ì„œ ë‚˜ì˜¤ê³  ì§„ì§œ ë¯¸ì³¤ìŒ...

Iâ€™ve dined here once and have done takeouts plenty of time. This time, I picked up some chicken congee and shrimp dumplings which both were tasty. Also the price for the congee is great cause I thought it would be a pint but ended up being a quart. Thereâ€™s two entrances and one is for takeout and the other is to dine in. Plenty of dim sum options and their beef chow fun is delicious. Love getting their Portuguese egg tarts as well. Itâ€™s great not having to trek all the way to Chinatown to get dim sum.

No wait time when we went for lunch. Service was good and quick. Everyone was friendly but it was a bit odd, we were stared at a lot and once we were done, it felt immediately like we were rushed out even though there were plenty of seats and we werenâ€™t disruptive or anything. One of our party was even in a suit and tie. The restaurant itself looked really nice and high class. The food came out super quick and hot which was great! The food was flavorful and delicious besides the salt and pepper pork chop. No flavor and tasted a bit burnt. The prices were a bit high but overall food was great.

I was craving some Dim Sum one day after work and I googled Dim Sum near me, there were a few options around but they didnâ€™t open until after 5pm so I found this place and decided to try it out! I went solo and saw other solo dinners too! It is on one of the side streets, but close to the Fulton Center train station if you donâ€™t want to drive as parking is challenging in the City.
They had a vast selection of items to choose from, but I couldnâ€™t go all out as it was only me, to try more items go with a group,However the ones I selected were sumptuous. The prices for the dim sum and regular menu items werenâ€™t too over the top.
I am big on customer service so wasnâ€™t too satisfied with the young male server who attended to me, but there was another older gentleman who worked there who was attentive and asked if I was good, probably because he saw me taking pics. He may have figured I was going to Review somewhere. So service could be improved.
Food was good and I would definitely go back when feeling for Dim Sum again!

This Dim Sum Palace location is one of the more modern and nicely decorated in the chain. While a few dishes stood out - like the XO fried turnip cake and seafood pea shoot dumplings - the overall dim sum quality was just okay; the pan-fried tiny buns were disappointing - they were barely fried and not crispy at all. The entree menu also felt somewhat limited in terms of traditional Cantonese offerings. Itâ€™s a convenient spot for dim sum in FiDi, though Chinatown offers a wider variety of options just a short distance away.

A pretty big place with a huge menu that it's not possible to try everything, however everything that tried was just perfect.  The only thing that was not that great were the juicy crab and pork Dumplings as they were so greasy that even leaked through the container all over the table.  While the servers were fast amd polite they seemed a bit distant and didn't care too much to be a bit friendlier.  Also the only thing that was not to the liking were the tables that had a huge metal construction under so it wasn't too comfortable to sit.

I am a patron here, this spot is amazing. The quality of the food is to die for. I will continue to come for as long as I can. The prices are so reasonable and they stay open pretty late.  They have pitchers of different teas, trying the green tea today.  Best sesame buns in the US!

Delicious dim sum at great prices! We went during lunch time and it was my first stop of the trip, and the food did not disappoint. All the dim sum plates we ordered hit the spot, and they had a ton of options from small plates to large dishes to share. They also have live fish which you can order and great cocktails.

Visited this restaurant recently and found some positive aspects. The location is excellent, the interior is gorgeous, and the atmosphere is cozy. However, I found the food to be merely acceptable.

The restaurant shares its kitchen with the neighboring establishment. Customers can observe the food preparation from outside, providing a unique and engaging experience, whether they choose to dine in or take their food to go. Overall, it's a mixed experience for me.

Large variety on the DimSum Menu as well as traditional Chinese dishes(Hong Kong style) including Peking Duck and Roasted Duck. Full Bar. Clean new facilites and comfortable seating. Artsy nature wall decor.

I was in the area for a doctorâ€™s appointment and found this place nearby. It was the first meal Iâ€™ve had in days and was one of the best things to wake up to. The shrimp dumplings are fantastic and a nice treat for the area. Iâ€™ll be back again.

I walked into the restaurant with high hopes, lured by the seductive promise of their signature duck dish. The menu made it sound like something out of a culinary dream: succulent, tender meat with crispy skin that melts in your mouth. I was sold. My mouth was watering before I even sat down, visions of perfectly roasted duck dancing in my head. But when the plate finally arrived, my enthusiasm quickly turned to confusion, then to sorrow. What I was presented with wasnâ€™t a duckâ€”it was more like a duck skeleton. More bones than a cemetery, and less meat than a chicken wing at a Super Bowl party.

I stared at the plate in disbelief, poking around to see if, by some miracle, there was more meat hidden under the carnage. No such luck. The duck had been picked cleaner than a crime scene. Iâ€™m not saying I was expecting a lot, but I was at least hoping for something I could sink my teeth into, not just a collection of future soup stock. Maybe this was a culinary test, I thought. Perhaps they wanted me to appreciate the artistry of bone presentation. Or maybe, just maybe, they had run out of meat and hoped I wouldnâ€™t notice.

Pro tip: if you ever find yourself in the same predicament, make sure to specify that youâ€™d like meat *with* your bones. Unless, of course, youâ€™re into nibbling around the edges like a vulture. Otherwise, the only thing youâ€™ll leave with is a deeper appreciation for soup brothâ€”and a profound sense of culinary disappointment.

The venue is clean and bright since itâ€™s new.
The food tastes good but forgot one of our order so we got our fried snow pea leaves at last minute and it ruined a bit of the whole experience. The price is decent but a bit pricey compared to other places we have been.

Good dim sum spot near Wall Street, they had some one of a kind items like abalone shumai or black truffle shrimp dumpling. They have a full bar so if you want to order a cocktail with your dim sum you could, I like mine with hongkong style milk tea,unfortunately they donâ€™t provide the hot version so thereâ€™s only iced milk tea. The service was quick and the place is clean and bright. They accept cards with a 4 percent surcharge.

I like Dim Sum Palace so Iâ€™m happy that they finally have a restaurant in FiDi! Celebrated Lunar New Year with yummy dumplings and roast duck. Staff was attentive and accommodating. Atmosphere is traditional dumpling place but a bit elevated. It can be noisy in the main hall but thatâ€™s just part of the vibrant atmosphere.

Very decent new dim sum restaurant in Fidi offering a large selection of tasty dim sum in a clean & relaxing space. The booths are great and service is prompt. We tried several dishes and almost all were really good, with highlights being the haw gau, peashoot dumplings, salt & pepper squid, fish filet congee & egg tart.  We would not order again the shrimp rolls, which were much too small, and the green tea rice rolls didn't have enough filling or flavor. The egg tart was delicious. On another visit we tried the seafood chow mein & braised tofu & eggplant, all were really good. Overall, highly recommended.

Dim Sum Palace is a great place to go if youâ€™re in the neighborhood and craving dim sum. Iâ€™ve tried a bunch of the dishes on the menu and theyâ€™ve all been good. The food is fresh, the service is good, and the location is perfect.

I got a to go order of the Chief Special.  The Taro, Sweet Yam, & Broccoli with Salted Edd Yolk was delicious.  It's lightly battered like a tempura.  You can actually taste the Salted Egg.  Highly recommend it.

The restaurant has two sections with their own separate entrances.

If you just order to go or for pick up you enter on the left door.

The right door is for dine in only and has a bar.

09/272023

My order was cold.
The chicken was bland and  half cooked.

This most be a normal routine.

My food was literally ice cold. I had to go back to my office and heat my food up.

I am not sure were the condiment covers were and if it was even safe to eat it do to the dim lighting above the condiments

I ordered duck soup. It was too much money for the small portion of the food that was given.

I asked for a receipt and the cashier Vincent and was told the receipt was going to be attached to my food. When my number was called I had to describe what I ordered.

Why not just duplicate the receipt.

It is a relatively new Chinese restaurant in Financial District.  Nicely decorated and good service. We had a few dim sums and Singapore Mei Fun.  Quality of food is good overall, the only thing is their Seafood Rice noodle roll was actually just shrimps. Price is a little higher than nearby Chinatown restaurants

This is a brand new dim sum house / restaurant that just opened up this week. I had lunch here with my brother and we both enjoyed the lunch specials and the chickens feet. You can order regular Chinese dishes, lunch specials that include soup or a wide variety of dim sum. I usually get dim sum in China Town so I noticed the dim sum prices here tended to be a dollar or two higher but they had everything you would normally get in China Town.  They also have a take out area if you want to grab food and go. Itâ€™s a large restaurant with plenty of seating. Iâ€™ll definitely be back to try more of the dim sum.

I absolutely adore Dim sum palace! From the moment I step in, I'm greeted with warmth and a wonderful atmosphere. The staff is incredibly attentive and friendly, making every visit feel special. The menu is a delightful journey of flavors; honey walnut with jumbo shrimp is my absolute favorites. The attention to detail and quality of ingredients really shine through. Whether I'm celebrating a special occasion or simply craving a fantastic meal, dim sum palace never disappoints. I'm grateful to have such a gem in my dining repertoire!

This spots has amazing dim sum. The food comes out fast and has a good temperature.
We had the hot and sour soup, seafood shu mai, beef rice noodle roll and egg yolk buns. The dumplings are freshly made and the flavors of all dishes were really good.
The restaurant has a clean look, seating is spacious and seats are comfortable.
Only point of criticism would be the plastic spoon with the sauces which made it hard to put on the plate. Same for the chop sticks, these were made of plastic what made eating the dumplings quite hard. For the rest would definitely come back as other dishes served around us looked really good.

We went to the to go side if dimsum palace, the space is definitely just for take out and a fee seats to eat at.  We came around 1 pm lunch hour peak time, we only ordered egg tart and we had to wait for a long time. The egg tarts were were already cooked and ready.  But because we want to try it, we waited. Just be careful to rude costumers who will skip the line because they speak the language.  One lady with the nyp scrubs with Physical therapist uniform name literally skipped me and she spoke their language and the cashier didnt correct her right away and that she needs to go at the back as there are other people behind me.

Very classy place, delicious food and the custom service were on point. For example, I asked my sever for one to go order. In a few minutes, one of the staff placed the bag of food on the table too close to my plate. I was still having my lunch. I did think it was too close but didn't make a fuss. Within seconds, my server came over, took the bag, tucked in the handles, and placed the bag in the corner away from my space. It is very much appreciated! Food was also delicious, and the black truffle dumplings were perfect.

When we got there, we had looked around. People just ordered dim sum or something from the menu. We had took advantage of their promotion and ordered whole peaking duck, lobster and salmon caviar fried rice. When the foods arrive, people been asking us what are those? We told them we had ordered their promotions dishes. Other people started to follow us and ordered their promotions dishes as well. When our bill came, someone had messed up and charged us full price. Luckily we saw that and had let them know. They had apologize and straighten things out for us. We will go back and order the other 3 dishes which is Vancouver crab, truffle fried rice and lives sea bass.
Freshly made and tasty dim sum. Itâ€™s packed in weekend so you might have to wait in the line for a while, but service was good.

Had dinner with friends in a room Saturday. Very nice setting.  Staffs are friendly and nice. Loved the food. Great price. Most importantly itâ€™s kids friendly (not a lot restaurant have private rooms). Didnâ€™t have to worry about kids be loud or get off their seats.

The BEST egg yolk buns!! Soft and pillowy on the outside and filled with sweet, rich liquid gold within- YUM! Also the interior of the restaurant is beautiful with comfy chairs. The rest of the menu is good too.
